main.title: Effect of nutritionally modified infant formula on academic performance
main.bio: Children who are given nutrient or supplement enriched formula milk as babies do not appear to have higher exam scores as adolescents than those fed with standard formula, finds this study

titles.title: Exercise versus usual care after non-reconstructive breast cancer surgery
titles.bio: Women who exercise shortly after having non-reconstructive breast cancer surgery appear to regain better shoulder and arm mobility and experience less pain than those who receive standard care, concludes this study

titles.title: Have international in-person medical meetings had their day?
titles.bio: The pandemic has changed how conferences are conducted. Richard Smith says that now is the time to change the status quo forever. But Viknesh Sounderajah and Ara Darzi argue that going entirely virtual would lose many of the features that make meetings so valuable

titles.title: Covid-19: Researcher blows the whistle on data integrity issues in Pfizer’s vaccine trial
titles.bio: Evidence from a whistleblower engaged in Pfizer’s pivotal covid-19 vaccine trial raises serious questions about data integrity and regulatory oversight

headlines.title: Priority setting and net zero healthcare: how much health can a tonne of carbon buy?
headlines.description: Cutting carbon emissions in healthcare requires trade-offs for clinicians, administrators, and global health policy makers and must be included when evaluating interventions, argue Anand Bhopal and Ole F Norheim

headlines.title: Accelerating climate action: the role of health professionals
headlines.description: Time is running out to reverse, or even halt, the damage done by humanity to our planet. Both individual action and promotion of systemic change are essential

headlines.title: Covid-19: global vaccine production is a mess and shortages are down to more than just hoarding
headlines.description: Vaccination efforts around the world are being restrained by a shortage of doses. Jane Feinmann looks at what is holding up the process

headlines.title: Covid-19 treatments and vaccines must be evaluated in pregnancy
headlines.description: Pregnant women should be included in drug and vaccine development from the outset, argues this Editorial
